alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Harrison (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 13 at 8:02PM EDT until April 13 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HARRISON...SOUTH CENTRAL FLOYD...SOUTHEASTERN MEADE...SOUTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...NORTH CENTRAL HARDIN AND NORTHWESTERN BULLITT COUNTIES... At 802 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Valley Station, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Shively, Shepherdsville, Valley Station, Pleasure Ridge Par, Pleasure Ridge Park, St. Dennis, Radcliff, Muldraugh, West Point and Lanesville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for south central Indiana...and central Kentucky. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
